snippet: The retired officer, Col. Vladimir Lazar, was charged with espionage for selling what officials said were classified topographical maps to a man they said was a Pentagon agent.
abstract: Court in Moscow sentences retired Russian Col Vladimir Lazar to 12 years in prison for spying for the United States; Lazar had been charged with espionage for selling what officials said were classified topographical maps to a man they said was a Pentagon agent.
lead_paragraph: The retired officer, Col. Vladimir Lazar, was charged with espionage for selling what officials said were classified topographical maps to a man they said was a Pentagon agent.

headline.main: Russia: Ex-Officer Sentenced to 12 Years After Being Convicted of Spying for U.S.
headline.print_headline: Russia: Ex-Officer Sentenced to 12 Years After Being Convicted of Spying for U.S.
